alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Marion County through 215 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Ocala Airport, or near Ocala, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Fort McCoy, Citra, Sparr, Anthony, Orange Springs, Ocala Airport, Reddick, Hog Valley and Lowell. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
